​​About The Role:

We are looking for a dependable Compounding Pharmacy Technician that will compound non-sterile medications. Working with our pharmacy team, you will help maintain and drive an amazing, modern, and innovative pharmacy service.

As a Compounding Pharmacy Technician you will keep accurate records, up to date with training, and compound medications for Hims & Hers Pharmacy.  This is an opportunity to help promote a safe, efficient and impactful pharmacy team at the core of taking care of our patients.

This role is based onsite in our New Albany, Ohio facility. We are currently prioritizing hiring for the following day shifts. If the shifts listed below do not align with your preferences, we would still love for you to apply! Our pharmacy technician teams are growing and we are constantly adding shifts. When submitting your application, please select the shift(s) that you are interested in and the recruiting team will reach out when that shift opens up.

Shifts we are currently looking for:

  • Front Half Days: Sunday - Wednesday | 7:00 AM - 5:30 PM

  • Back Half Days: Wednesday - Saturday | 7:00 AM - 5:30 PM

 

In This Role You Will:

  • Compound Non-sterile medications.

  • Keep accurate compounding records.

  • Maintain and clean compounding lab.

  • Communicate with pharmacists and report on issues in the lab.

  • Receives and verifies delivered orders; restocks medication shelves and supply bins; rotates and removes outdated drugs; maintains a clean working environment including Pharmacy equipment and work counters; maintains stock records.

  • Assists in record keeping, and reporting efficiency numbers to pharmacist in charge.

  • Provides quality assurance assistance to pharmacist in charge.

You Have:

  • 3+ years compounding experience.

  • Active Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT) registration with the Ohio Board of Pharmacy

  • Strong communication skills and can work independently.

  • Full time role 40 hours per week.

  • 4 x 10 hour work week.

Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):

  • Competitive salary & comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision

 

Conditions of Employment: 

  • This position will require working with Hazardous Drugs (HD) and would require that Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) be worn for the length of working with these drugs. These items would include gloves, respiratory protection, gown and other items as required.

  • This position requires medical approval to wear respiratory protection in the form of negative or positive pressure respirators, including N95, full face respirator, SCBA, or Powered Air Purifying Respirator (PAPR).

  • Physical exertion required. Including, but not limited to, walking up to 50% of the time, standing up to 100% of the time, squatting and bending up to 20% of the time and lifting up to 80% of the time for up to a twelve hour shift. Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.

  • Due to the risk of reproductive capability in handling or compounding certain Hazardous Drugs (HD) associates must be willing to confirm that they understand the potential risks (teratogenicity, carcinogenicity and reproductive effects) of handling hazardous drugs.

  • Strong communication skills and can work independently.

  • Full time role 40 hours per week.

Preferred: 

  • 3+ year sterile compounding experience in nonsterile to sterile compounding or 1+ year in sterile-to-sterile compounding.

  • Prior experience at a sterile pharmaceutical manufacturer.

  • 1+ year experience in leadership role.

  • 1+ year as a sterile or nonsterile trainer.

  • Competitive salary & comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision

  • This position requires medical approval to wear respiratory protection in the form of negative or positive pressure respirators, including N95, full face respirator, SCBA, or Powered Air Purifying Respirator (PAPR).

  • Physical exertion required. Including, but not limited to, walking up to 50% of the time, standing up to 100% of the time, squatting and bending up to 20% of the time and lifting up to 80% of the time for up to a twelve hour shift. Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.

  • Due to the risk of reproductive capability in handling or compounding certain Hazardous Drugs (HD) associates must be willing to confirm that they understand the potential risks (teratogenicity, carcinogenicity and reproductive effects) of handling hazardous drugs.

  • Ability to manage multiple priorities, adapt to changing production needs, and work effectively under pressure.

  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and perform physical tasks, including walking, standing, and bending.

As a Staff Software Engineer in our newly formed App Foundations Squad, you will define the architecture and development plan of the next generation of our iOS mobile applications (hims and hers), building prototypes to rapidly prove out the concept and then assembling the team that can deliver a best-in-class mobile experience for our customers.

Your work will directly impact how customers access care, manage their health, and engage with our platform.

  • Break down complex problems into actionable implementation plans and guide architectural decisions aligned with long-term strategy.

  • Design scalable, maintainable mobile solutions with minimal rework, full test coverage and clear documentation.

  • Work in close collaboration with our web team to identify best practices in balancing native mobile user experiences with web views and flows.

  • Help to define the API contracts which will allow our mobile app to deliver best in class user experience while not sacrificing speed of delivery of new product categories within the mobile app

  • Collaborate with our analytics team to define and implement robust observability (e.g., monitoring, logging, alerting) alongside key KPIs and SLOs to ensure system reliability and performance.

  • Own code quality through thoughtful reviews, maintainable architecture, and proactive technical debt reduction.

  • Collaborate with Product and Design during discovery to define MVPs, validate feasibility, and drive customer-centric solutions.

  • Coordinate with backend, data, and platform teams for seamless integrations and aligned execution.

  • Mentor engineers and promote best practices in design, testing, CI/CD, and team rituals.

  • Help migrate our existing mobile and front-end teams from a “build features as they are requested” to “build platforms which support all features we currently and will support.”

You Have:

  • 8–10+ years of experience delivering production-grade software solutions in native iOS

  • Deep experience with the best iOS development technologies, including Swift, SwiftData/Core Data and GraphQL, as well as cutting-edge UX frameworks like SwiftUI, Rive and Lottie.

  • Solid understanding of web performance optimization within the iOS ecosystem.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to navigate ambiguity through iterative experimentation.

  • Comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment and driving high-impact solutions from concept through execution.

What Success Looks Like:

  • You reliably and quickly deliver prototypes to prove out architectural design, product direction and mobile.

  • You help drive a culture of code quality, accountability, and collaboration by mentoring peers and sharing technical insights.

  • You successfully build a team which will develop our first fully native mobile experience

  • You lead your squad to take ownership of the entire mobile experience, championing reliability, scalability, and maintainability.

  • You identify technical risks early and help improve the sustainability and scalability of team practices and architecture.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

About the Role:

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Environmental Monitoring (EM) Specialist to perform routine environmental sampling and support contamination control within our sterile pharmaceutical compounding cleanroom facilities. This role is essential in ensuring a controlled environment for aseptic operations and maintaining compliance with USP <797>, USP <800>, and 503A/503B regulatory standards.

Working under the supervision of the Microbiologist, the EM Specialist will be responsible for executing all aspects of the environmental monitoring program, including sample collection, incubation, documentation, reporting, and assisting in microbial investigations and laboratory submissions.

You Will:

  • Perform routine non-viable and viable air sampling, surface sampling, and personnel monitoring sampling within ISO-classified cleanroom environments.

  • Ensure proper handling and labeling of sampling media to maintain integrity throughout the sampling and incubation process.

  • Accurately document sampling events, locations, results, and observations in compliance with internal SOPs and regulatory expectations.

  • Adhere to defined sampling schedules and respond to unscheduled or investigative sampling needs.

  • Manage the proper incubation of solid and liquid microbiological media at appropriate temperature conditions (e.g., 20–25°C and 30–35°C).

  • Perform interim and final readings of incubated media plates to identify and enumerate Colony Forming Units (CFUs).

  • Report and investigate results at alert and/or action levels.

  • Support the Microbiologist in responding to microbial growth events, including sample handling, documentation of excursions, and generation of preliminary reports.

  • Coordinate submission of microbial-positive samples to third-party laboratories and assist in investigation data gathering.

  • Maintain investigation logs and contribute to root cause analysis and corrective action activities.

You Have:

  • Minimum 1 year of experience in one or more of the following:

    • Non-viable particulate air sampling

    • Viable air sampling using impaction or settling plates

    • Surface sampling using contact plates or swabs

    • Personnel aseptic technique and gown sampling

  • Knowledge in gram staining and microbial growth identification.

  • Ability to work in sterile garb for extended periods within an ISO Class 5 or cleaner environment.

  • Successful completion or ability to pass initial and ongoing garbing and aseptic competency evaluations.

  • Working knowledge of USP <795>, USP <797>, USP <800>, and sterile compounding requirements.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Licensed Pharmacy Technician with active state licensure and PTCB certification.

  • Prior experience in a 503A or 503B compounding pharmacy or aseptic pharmaceutical manufacturing environment.

  • Familiarity with microbial growth morphology and plate reading.

  • Understanding of incubation practices, environmental excursion documentation, and laboratory sample chain-of-custody procedures.

  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to aseptic technique and contamination control.

Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):

  • Competitive salary & equity compensation for full-time roles

Conditions of Employment:

  • This position will require working with Hazardous Drugs (HD) and would require that Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) be worn for the length of working with these drugs. These items would include gloves, respiratory protection, gown and other items as required.

  • This position requires medical approval to wear respiratory protection in the form of negative or positive pressure respirators, including N95, full face respirator, SCBA, or Powered Air Purifying Respirator (PAPR).

  • Physical exertion required. Including, but not limited to, walking up to 50% of the time, standing up to 100% of the time, squatting and bending up to 20% of the time and lifting up to 80% of the time for up to a twelve hour shift. Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.

  • Due to the risk of reproductive capability in handling or compounding certain Hazardous Drugs (HD) associates must be willing to confirm that they understand the potential risks (teratogenicity, carcinogenicity and reproductive effects) of handling hazardous drugs.

We are committed to building a workforce that reflects diverse perspectives and prioritizes ethics, wellness, and a strong sense of belonging. If you're excited about this role, we encourage you to apply—even if you're not sure if your background or experience is a perfect match.

Hims considers all qualified applicants for employment, including applicants with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the California Fair Chance Act, and any similar state or local fair chance laws.

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

About the Role

As VP of Research and Development and Innovation, you will lead the full lifecycle of product innovation—from early-stage research and ideation through product development, technology transfer, and commercialization. You will champion a translational R&D approach, ensuring that scientific discoveries and novel concepts are efficiently developed into high-quality, scalable products and seamlessly handed off to Operations. You will also be responsible for identifying, assessing, and integrating innovative technologies within both 503A and 503B compounding environments to expand our product portfolio, optimize production, and ensure compliance.

Responsibilities

  • You will Drive and deliver the Innovation pipeline and the development of innovative strategies to advance Him's scientific capabilities, competitive advantage, and product pipeline

  • You will Lead the end-to-end innovation process, transforming research concepts into viable, commercialized products, with clear transition pathways to manufacturing and operations.

  • You will develop and execute a comprehensive Innovation and R&D strategy, aligning scientific capabilities with strategic business goals across regulated environments, including 503A patient-specific and 503B outsourcing facilities.

  • You will build and manage a high-performing R&D function, including research scientists, formulation experts, and product development professionals.

  • Foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the R&D team

  • Establish and oversee R&D infrastructure, including lab and transfer scale production, and analytical capabilities, with a focus on QbD, Speed and quality, regulatory compliance (cGMP, USP 795/797/800).

  • Evaluate emerging technologies and platforms relevant to pharmaceutical, nutraceutical, and supplement innovation, with a focus on applicability in 503A and 503B settings.

  • Develop technical assessments and feasibility studies for new formulations, delivery systems, and process innovations to accelerate time-to-market and improve therapeutic outcomes.

  • Partner with Regulatory, Quality, Medical and Operations to ensure a seamless handoff of new products and technologies from development to manufacturing and market launch.

  • Drive continuous improvement in R&D processes, promoting a culture of scientific excellence, agility, and accountability.

  • Communicate regularly with senior leadership to provide updates on Innovation projects, progress, and challenges

  • You will remain current on industry developments and advancements in product portfolios and technology and monitor and analyze industry trends, competition, and consumer feedback to continuously improve and evolve product offerings

Qualifications

Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Chemical Engineering, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Formulation Science, Food Science, Microbiology, Chemistry, or related field.

  • 12+ years of progressive experience in Innovation, R&D, or Product Development, including leadership roles in pharmaceutical, compounding, or supplement manufacturing sectors.

  • Strong knowledge of pharmaceutical product Innovation processes. Experience across Sterile, non-sterile and multiple dosage forms in both development and large scale operations

  • Demonstrated track record of building, leading, and managing R&D and innovation teams. Experience in building and establishing R&D infrastructure, including laboratory setup, equipment procurement, and compliance.

  • Strong business acumen and the ability to align Innovation strategies with overall business objectives.

  • Deep understanding of regulatory and operational environments, and experience developing products within these frameworks.

  • Demonstrated success in advancing concepts from research through development and into full commercialization.

  • Strong technical knowledge in pharmaceutical formulation, delivery systems, and analytical methods.

  • Strategic mindset with strong business acumen and the ability to translate innovation strategy into tangible results.

  • Ability to operate in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and effectively prioritize complex initiatives.

  • Demonstrated track record of building, leading, and managing Innovation teams

  • Experience working cross-functionally to identify and execute product improvement and consistency through reformulations and maintenance initiatives

  • Organized, methodical, strong steering, analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Ability to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and environments

Preferred:

  • 503A and 503B Experience

  • REgulatory CMC preparation experience

  • Professional memberships - e.g. American Association Pharmaceutical Scientists (AAPS), Controlled release society (CRS) membership/experience.

  • Experience working with Regulatory authorities.

  • Medical or Pharmacist experience, background

About the Role:

The Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT) is responsible for performing high-complexity testing and analysis of clinical specimens. This role supports accurate diagnosis and patient care by ensuring timely and reliable test results in accordance with laboratory protocols and regulatory standards.

Shift:

The shifts we have available are below:

  • Tuesday–Friday, 1:00 PM–9:00 PM; Saturday, 11:00 AM–7:00 PM

You Will:

  • Perform routine and specialized analysis on blood, serum, urine, and other body fluids using automated analyzers and manual techniques.

  • Operate, maintain, and troubleshoot chemistry instrumentation, ensuring proper calibration and quality control.

  • Review and validate test results; identify and resolve discrepancies or abnormal findings in a timely manner.

  • Adhere to laboratory SOPs, CLIA standards, and quality assurance practices.

  • Monitor and document quality control data, instrument maintenance logs, and reagent inventory.

  • Collaborate with fellow technologists, laboratory assistants, and supervisory staff to maintain efficient workflow.

  • Participate in proficiency testing, competency assessments, and continuing education activities.

  • Maintain accurate and thorough documentation in the Laboratory Information System (LIS).

  • Follow all safety protocols, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and proper handling of biohazardous materials.

You Have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Medical Laboratory Science, Clinical Laboratory Science, Chemistry, or a related field.

  • Current certification as a Medical Laboratory Technologist (e.g., ASCP, AMT, or equivalent) preferred.

  • Minimum of 1–2 years of clinical chemistry laboratory experience preferred (new grads may be considered).

  • Familiarity with automated chemistry and hematology analyzers (e.g., Roche, Beckman Coulter, Sysmex).

  • Strong attention to detail, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

  • Proficient with laboratory information systems and Microsoft Office applications.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience in general chemistry, special chemistry, and/or toxicology testing.

  • Familiarity with LIS systems

About the Role:

The Laboratory Assistant is a vital member of the clinical laboratory team responsible for receiving, sorting, and accessioning incoming biological samples from various couriers. This position ensures that specimens are accurately entered into the Laboratory Information System (LIS) and prepared for timely processing and testing by laboratory personnel.

Shift:

The shifts we have available are below:

  • Tuesday–Friday, 1:00 PM–9:00 PM; Saturday, 11:00 AM–7:00 PM

You Will:

  • Receive and log incoming specimen shipments from multiple carriers in accordance with standard operating procedures.

  • Verify specimen integrity, labeling, and accompanying test order for completeness and accuracy.

  • Accession specimens into the Laboratory Information System (LIS), assigning unique identifiers and linking them to the correct patient and test order.

  • Sort and organize specimens by department or test type, ensuring correct prioritization and handling.

  • Prepare specimens for testing, including aliquoting, centrifuging, labeling, and distributing to appropriate lab departments.

  • Communicate promptly with laboratory staff and user experience team regarding discrepancies, missing information, or urgent specimens.

  • Maintain accurate documentation of all received and processed samples.

  • Follow biohazard safety protocols and ensure compliance with HIPAA and laboratory safety regulations.

  • Assist with routine laboratory support tasks such as inventory, specimen storage, and disposal.

You Have:

  • High school diploma or equivalent required; associate degree or completion of a laboratory assistant training program preferred.

  • Previous experience in a clinical laboratory or healthcare environment strongly preferred.

  • Familiarity with laboratory procedures, medical terminology, and specimen handling requirements.

  • Proficiency in data entry and comfort with laboratory information systems (LIS).

  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.

  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

  • Must be able to lift packages up to 30 lbs and stand for extended periods.

About the Role:

We are seeking a Sterile Compounding Pharmacist to oversee sterile compounding operations within a modular cleanroom suite. In this role, you will act as a subject matter expert, ensuring compliance with USP <797>, <800>, and other applicable guidelines. You will supervise personnel and maintain the highest standards for compounding safety, quality, and compliance in accordance with state and federal regulations.

Shift differential available for night shifts

Shift: 6:00pm-6:00am, rotating 3-2-2-3 schedule

You Will:

  • Direct shift sterile compounding activities in compliance with USP 797 and USP 800.

  • Maintain and enforce proper aseptic technique and cleanroom standards

  • Provide training and technical guidance to compounding and support personnel performing aseptic manipulations, presterilization activities, visual inspection, labeling/packaging, materials/equipment preparation and movement.

  • Perform and accurately document compounding procedures, quality assurance/quality control checks, of compounded sterile preparations

  • Review and approve materials prior to use in sterile compounding

  • Oversee use of equipment used in sterile compounding operations to used in sterile compounding operations in conjunction with the maintenance team

  • Oversee cleanroom workflow, daily logs and environmental monitoring procedures in conjunction with quality.

  • Work closely with R&D Teams on the development and scale up of new compounded sterile preparations.

  • Follow all safety, USP, BOP, and internal guidelines for the preparation of compounded medications.

  • Maintain a safety-first mindset and ensure precautions are taken in all compounding activities in accordance with USP 797 including when working with hazardous chemicals in accordance with USP <800> and applicable laws

  • When required, wear all personal protective equipment (PPE)

  • Coordinate with the Pharmacist-in-charge (PIC), Sterile Compounding Manager, Pharmacist, and/or Lead Sterile Compounding Pharmacist for personnel, quality, compliance and regulatory matters.

  • Willingness to complete external training as required

You Have:

  • Pharmacist experience with experience in sterile compounding preferably compounding from nonsterile starting components.

  • Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm D) or Bachelor’s degree in Pharmacy from an accredited institution.

  • Active Pharmacist License in State of employment (OH)

  • Proficiency in USP 797 and 800 requirements and best practices.

  • Current knowledge of state and federal pharmacy laws, rules and regulations related to the practice of pharmacy

  • Ability to work flexible shift times

  • Proficiency in Windows based computer systems

  • Must be able to undergo respirator fit testing - Full beards or a lot of facial hair may prevent a proper seal for the respirator

  • Must be a knowledgeable and empathetic leader to in-person pharmacist and technician teams

  • Must be able to lift at least 25 pounds with or without reasonable accommodation

  • Must be able to stand for long periods of time

  • Pharmacists will work in a variety of positions and locations such as sitting, standing, squatting, kneeling, reaching, and walking; for prolonged periods of time

  • Must be able to wear required compounding safety equipment for long periods of time when required.

  • Maintain all security and privacy rules regarding the use and handling of protected health information (PHI) in compliance with federal and state HIPAA regulations

  • Follow all state and pharmacy regulations and rules as designated by the required State Board of Pharmacy and the Food and Drug Administration (FDA)

  • Maintain a clean and sanitary work environment as mandated by the FDA’s rules and regulations

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience compounding from non sterile starting components.

  • Familiarity with electronic documentation systems and compounding workflow software.

Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):

  • Competitive salary & comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision

Conditions of Employment:

  • This position will require working with Hazardous Drugs (HD) and would require that Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) be worn for the length of working with these drugs. These items would include gloves, respiratory protection, gown and other items as required.

  • This position requires medical approval to wear respiratory protection in the form of negative or positive pressure respirators, including N95, full face respirator, SCBA, or Powered Air Purifying Respirator (PAPR).

  • Physical exertion required. Including, but not limited to, walking up to 50% of the time, standing up to 100% of the time, squatting and bending up to 20% of the time and lifting up to 80% of the time for up to a twelve hour shift. Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.

  • Due to the risk of reproductive capability in handling or compounding certain Hazardous Drugs (HD) associates must be willing to confirm that they understand the potential risks (teratogenicity, carcinogenicity and reproductive effects) of handling hazardous drugs.

Hims & Hers is seeking a seasoned, business-minded Managing Counsel, Legislative and Policy to lead the legislative and policy-related vertical within the legal team and partner closely with business units across the organization. In this role, you will be responsible for strategic legal guidance on a wide array of legislative, policy, and public affairs issues and initiatives, helping drive business goals while effectively managing legal risk. This is a key legal leadership position for an experienced legislative or policy attorney eager to help shape the legislative legal team in a high-growth, dynamic, mission-driven healthcare company. This role will be accountable for the overall strategy, performance, and risk management within the subject matter area, exercising broad discretion and authority.

You Will:

  • Lead the company’s legislative legal function, advising on a broad range of legislative and policy matters across all jurisdictions where the company does business, including support of federal, 50 state, and international legislative and regulatory activities.

  • Provide strategic counsel to the Government Affairs and Communications teams, and senior leadership on issues related to the company’s policy agenda, including compounding, pharmacy operations, data privacy, artificial intelligence, corporate practice of medicine, direct-to-consumer telehealth, and more.

  • Oversee and support the review of talking points, briefings, proactive and reactive legislative initiatives, federal and state agency rulemaking, proactive or reactive policy communications, company policy principles, playbooks, collateral, and more.

  • Advise on the legal impact of proposed laws, rules, and regulations at the federal, state, and international level.

  • Collaborate with the Government Affairs team on various federal and state policy strategies, while cross-coordinating with other legal team stakeholders, including the litigation, product, and privacy teams.

  • Lead legal engagement with various trade associations and provide legal insights in meetings with external consultants.

  • Monitor evolving trends in Federal and state laws, rules, and regulations which have a material impact on the business, and translate them into practical recommendations for the business.

  • Mentor and manage a team of legislative counsel and legal professionals, contributing to a culture of collaboration, excellence, and professional growth.

  • Manage outside counsel when needed.

You Have:

  • J.D. from an ABA-accredited law school and current active license to practice law in at least one US jurisdiction.

  • 12+ years of legal experience, including significant in-house legislative or policy counsel experience at a high-growth, highly regulated company; healthcare experience is strongly preferred.

  • Deep expertise in one of the following policy and legislative areas: AI, consumer health data privacy, direct-to-consumer telehealth, corporate practice of medicine, compounding, or pharmacy operations.

  • Demonstrated ability to build strong, trust-based partnerships with business leadership and legal peers.

  • Strong leadership and team development experience, with a track record of mentoring and managing attorneys and other legal professionals.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially in translating complex legal issues into clear, actionable guidance.

  • A proactive, solutions-oriented mindset, with the ability to navigate ambiguity and scale legal processes in a growing organization.

  • A passion for the Hims & Hers mission, with a commitment to supporting a culture of compliance and excellence.

  • Review and approve materials prior to use in sterile compounding

  • Oversee use of equipment to used in sterile compounding operations and monitor the compounding environment in conjunction with the maintenance team

  • Oversee cleanroom workflow, daily logs and environmental monitoring procedures in conjunction with quality

  • Maintain a safety-first mindset and ensure precautions are taken in all compounding activities in accordance with USP 797 including when working with hazardous chemicals in accordance with USP <800> and applicable laws

  • When required, wear all personal protective equipment (PPE)

  • Coordinate with the Pharmacist-in-charge (PIC) and/or Sterile Compounding Manager, Pharmacist for personnel, quality, compliance and regulatory matters

  • Willingness to complete external training as required

You Have:

  • 3 years of pharmacist experience

  • 1+ years of pharmacist experience with experience in sterile compounding preferably compounding from nonsterile starting components Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm D) or Bachelor’s degree in Pharmacy from an accredited institution

  • Active Pharmacist License in State of employment (OH or AZ)

  • Proficiency in USP 797 and 800 requirements and best practices.

  • Current knowledge of state and federal pharmacy laws, rules and regulations related to the practice of pharmacy

  • Served in leadership role

  • Ability to work flexible shift times

  • Proficiency in Windows based computer systems

  • Must be able to undergo respirator fit testing - Full beards or a lot of facial hair may prevent a proper seal for the respirator

  • Must be a knowledgeable and empathetic leader to in-person pharmacist and technician teams

  • Must be able to lift at least 25 pounds with or without reasonable accommodation

  • Must be able to stand for long periods of time

  • Pharmacists will work in a variety of positions and locations such as sitting, standing, squatting, kneeling, reaching, and walking; for prolonged periods of time

  • Must be able to wear required compounding safety equipment for long periods of time when required

  • Maintain all security and privacy rules regarding the use and handling of protected health information (PHI) in compliance with federal and state HIPAA regulations

  • Follow all state and pharmacy regulations and rules as designated by the required State Board of Pharmacy and the Food and Drug Administration (FDA)

  • Maintain a clean and sanitary work environment as mandated by the FDA’s rules and regulations

Preferred:

  • Experience compounding from non sterile starting components.

  • Familiarity with electronic documentation systems and compounding workflow software

  • Experience with regulatory inspections (e.g., State Board, FDA, NABP).

  • 1+ years in a managerial role over Pharmacists, Technicians, and pharmacy support personnel

Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):

  • Competitive salary & comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision

Conditions of Employment:

  • This position will require working with Hazardous Drugs (HD) and would require that Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) be worn for the length of working with these drugs. These items would include gloves, respiratory protection, gown and other items as required.

  • Physical exertion required. Including, but not limited to, walking up to 50% of the time, standing up to 100% of the time, squatting and bending up to 20% of the time and lifting up to 80% of the time for up to a twelve hour shift. Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.

  • Due to the risk of reproductive capability in handling or compounding certain Hazardous Drugs (HD) associates must be willing to confirm that they understand the potential risks (teratogenicity, carcinogenicity and reproductive effects) of handling hazardous drugs.

About the Role:

This role oversees the Telehealth project management function—driving operational excellence, process improvement, and seamless coordination across product, clinical, operations, and growth teams.

You’ll play a key role in shaping how we deliver care at scale. This role combines program strategy, people leadership, and execution excellence—turning business goals into actionable plans and measurable outcomes. You’ll partner closely with senior leaders and guide a growing team to deliver initiatives that make care more efficient, scalable, and impactful.

You Will:

  • Own the operational strategy for telemedicine program management across Hims & Hers, ensuring alignment with company goals and long-term care delivery strategy.

  • Lead and grow a high-performing program management function—coaching, developing, and inspiring a team to deliver consistently high-quality results.

  • Define and scale governance frameworks that enable efficient prioritization, cross-functional alignment, and data-driven decision-making.

  • Drive the execution of complex initiatives, ensuring seamless collaboration across Product, Clinical, Operations, Growth, and R&D.

  • Establish and monitor success metrics and OKRs, tying program outcomes directly to patient experience, operational scalability, and financial impact.

  • Partner with executive and clinical leaders to identify opportunities for innovation in virtual care delivery and to remove operational or strategic barriers.

  • Champion process improvement and standardization, enhancing how projects are scoped, launched, and measured across the Care Experience organization.

  • Oversee launch readiness and continuous improvement, embedding feedback loops, retrospectives, and data insights to refine future initiatives.

  • Represent the Care Experience organization in cross-functional forums, influencing senior stakeholders and guiding strategic tradeoffs.

  • Foster a culture of accountability, transparency, and operational excellence across the telehealth delivery ecosystem.

You Have:

  • 9-12+ years of experience leading complex, cross-functional programs or portfolios in fast paced technology-enabled service organizations.

  • 4+ years of experience building, developing, and scaling high-performing teams, including both ICs and people leaders.

  • Demonstrated success driving transformation or care delivery initiatives from conception to execution with measurable business and patient outcomes.

  • Deep understanding of operations, virtual care workflows, and program design.

  • Proven ability to translate strategic vision into actionable roadmaps and deliver through influence across technical and non-technical teams.

  • Exceptional executive communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to distill complexity into clarity.

  • Strong systems thinking, process design, and change management expertise.

  • Adept at operating in fast-paced, ambiguous environments, balancing structure with agility.

  • Bachelor’s degree required

  • PMP, PgMP, or equivalent certification is a plus.

About the Role:

The Laboratory Supervisor is responsible for overseeing the daily operations of the clinical

laboratory, with a focus on the core laboratory. This role ensures accurate and timely testing,

regulatory compliance, quality control, and efficient workflow. The supervisor provides

leadership to laboratory staff, facilitates training and competency, and promotes a culture of

safety and continuous improvement.

Shift:

Tuesday–Friday, 2:00 PM–10:00 PM; Saturday, 10:00 AM–6:00 PM

You Will:

  • Supervise daily operations of the clinical/core laboratory, including test performance,

    specimen handling, and workflow coordination.

  • Ensure all laboratory activities comply with CLIA, Joint Commission, and other applicable

    regulatory standards.

  • Monitor and maintain quality control, quality assurance, and proficiency testing

    programs.

  • Oversee staff scheduling, workload distribution, and performance management.

  • Train, mentor, and evaluate laboratory technologists, technicians, and assistants;

    maintain competency and training documentation.

  • Assist with the development, revision, and implementation of standard operating

    procedures (SOPs).

  • Collaborate with user experience to address service issues and improve laboratory

    operations.

  • Investigate testing anomalies, equipment malfunctions, and non-conformances; initiate

    and document corrective actions.

  • Participate in instrument validation, method verification, and implementation of new

    assays or equipment.

  • Ensure inventory of reagents and supplies is maintained and monitor equipment service

    schedules.

  • Prepare operational reports, track performance metrics, and contribute to

    departmental planning and improvement initiatives.

You Have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Medical Laboratory Science, Clinical Laboratory Science, or a

    related field required.

  • Current certification as a Medical Technologist or Medical Laboratory Scientist (ASCP, or

    equivalent) preferred.

  • Minimum of 4+ years of clinical laboratory experience, preferably in a core laboratory

    environment.

  • At least 2 years supervisory or lead technologist experience.

  • Proficient in laboratory information systems (LIS) and data analysis tools.

  • Strong interpersonal, leadership, and problem-solving skills.

  • Detail-oriented and highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a

    fast-paced setting.

  • Experience with core laboratory platforms such as Beckman Coulter, Sysmex, and Roche

    analyzers (preferred)

  • Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days

About the Role:

We are looking for an energetic and dependable sterile compounding Technician who will serve as a group leader of sterile compounding technicians and/or sterile support staff during daily compounding operations. You will serve as a sterile trainer and evaluator of competency for sterile compounding staff. As a group leader and recognized trainer/evaluator, you will assist Supervising Pharmacists ensure compliance with USP 797, 800 (and other applicable chapters) and to compound sterile medications that are safe and effective for patients, under Pharmacist supervision.

Shift differential is available for overnight shifts.

Shift: 6:00pm-6:00am, rotating 3-2-2-3 schedule

You Will:

  • Lead a team of sterile compounding technicians and/or sterile support staff in performing sterile compounding activities in compliance with USP 797 and 800 and site SOPs.

  • You will help to ensure team members follow safety and environment monitoring and control procedures as outlined in the Site SOPs and that appropriate PPE is worn while executing daily, weekly, and monthly tasks.

  • You will serve as an Assigned Trainer and competency evaluator for new hire and ongoing sterile compounding and support staff in USP 797 and 800 required core skills, knowledge, and required competencies such as Garbing and Hand Hygiene, Aseptic Technique, and cleanroom suite cleaning assessments.

  • Compound sterile medications.

  • Assist with compounding equipment calibration and ensure appropriate use of equipment during daily sterile compounding operations.

  • Perform the formulation of the solutions and aseptic filling of the solutions

  • Perform daily, weekly and monthly cleanroom suite support responsibilities including, but not limited to, compounding materials and supplies preparation, equipment calibration, cleaning, dishwashing, and sterilization or depyrogenation of equipment, according to facility SOP’s.

  • Document compounding-related and daily, weekly, and monthly activities according to facility SOPs and as required by USP 797 and 800.

  • Coordinate with the Pharmacist-in-charge (PIC), Sterile Compounding Manager, Pharmacist, and/or Lead Sterile Compounding Pharmacist for personnel, quality, compliance and regulatory matters.

  • Communicate with Lead Sterile Compounding Pharmacists or Sterile Compounding Pharmacists to report on issues in the cleanroom suite.

  • Utilizes equipment as instructed by the pharmacist.

  • Completes training as required by USP 797 and 800 (and related chapters).

You Have:

  • 2+ years sterile compounding experience or 1+ year sterile compounding plus 1+ year nonsterile compounding experience.

  • Current registration as a Certified Pharmacy Technician in the State of Ohio and National Certification (CPhT)

  • Certified Compounded Sterile Preparation Technician® (CSPT®) or willingness to complete in the first year of employment.

  • Strong communication skills and can work independently.

  • Full time role 40 hours per week.

Preferred:

  • 3+ year sterile compounding experience in nonsterile to sterile compounding or 1+ year in sterile-to-sterile compounding.

  • Prior experience at a sterile pharmaceutical manufacturer.

  • 1+ year experience in leadership role.

  • 1+ year as a sterile or nonsterile trainer.

Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):

  • Competitive salary & comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision

Conditions of Employment:

  • This position will require working with Hazardous Drugs (HD) and would require that Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) be worn for the length of working with these drugs. These items would include gloves, respiratory protection, gown and other items as required.

  • This position requires medical approval to wear respiratory protection in the form of negative or positive pressure respirators, including N95, full face respirator, SCBA, or Powered Air Purifying Respirator (PAPR).

  • Physical exertion required. Including, but not limited to, walking up to 50% of the time, standing up to 100% of the time, squatting and bending up to 20% of the time and lifting up to 80% of the time for up to a twelve hour shift. Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.

  • Due to the risk of reproductive capability in handling or compounding certain Hazardous Drugs (HD) associates must be willing to confirm that they understand the potential risks (teratogenicity, carcinogenicity and reproductive effects) of handling hazardous drugs.

About the Role:

The Accounting team manages all aspects of day-to-day general ledger accounting and period-end close responsibilities include the creation and distribution of financial statements. To support business growth, we are seeking a highly experienced and strategic Director of Accounting to lead and oversee key accounting functions including capital expenditures (CAPEX), operating expenses (OPEX), financial consolidations, foreign subsidiary accounting and special accounting projects, including M&A integrations. This role will also be responsible for managing statutory reporting obligations across international entities, ensuring compliance with local GAAP and regulatory requirements.

The ideal candidate brings a strong technical accounting background, global operational experience, and a hands-on leadership style to ensure accurate financial reporting and efficient accounting processes in a growing and dynamic organization.

You Will:

  • Manage and improve consolidation processes, systems, and controls to support timely close cycles. Specifically, lead monthly, quarterly, and annual financial consolidations across all entities, ensuring accuracy and completeness.

  • Own M&A integrations into standard month-end close processes.

  • Oversee accounting activities of foreign subsidiaries to ensure compliance with local and corporate policies.

  • Ensure intercompany eliminations and foreign currency translations are handled accurately.

  • Oversee the accounting for capital projects, asset capitalization, depreciation, and impairment testing.

  • Ensure accurate tracking, classification, and reporting of OPEX across departments.

  • Collaborate with FP&A and operational teams to ensure alignment on budget vs actuals for both CAPEX and OPEX.

  • Manage and review local statutory filings in coordination with local management and external advisors.

  • Ensure timely completion of statutory audits and compliance with filing deadlines.

  • Lead, mentor, and develop a team of accounting professionals in a remote work environment. Restructure responsibilities and simplify workflows to maximize the efficiency of the offshore accounting team.

  • Ensure compliance with US GAAP and local accounting standards.

  • Partner with internal and external auditors for quarterly reviews and annual audits.

  • Drive continuous improvement in accounting processes, systems, and internal controls. Enhance accounting operations procedures to align with Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) requirements.

  • Perform Director-level reviews to maintain compliance with public company controls and oversee key controls within the AuditBoard SOX platform.

  • Address ad-hoc requests and resolve issues arising from daily general ledger accounting responsibilities.

  • Assist the team in documenting procedures and training manuals to support the efficient onboarding of new team members.

You Have:

  • 10+ years of progressive accounting experience, and at least 5 years in a leadership role.

  • BA or BS degree from a top-ranking university in accounting.

  • Big 4 accounting firm experience required.

  • Experience in managing international accounting operations and consolidations.

  • Strong knowledge of US GAAP, IFRS/local GAAP, and statutory reporting requirements.

  • Experience in a multinational public company environment.

  • Experience with process automation or finance transformation initiatives.

  • Proven ability to manage cross-functional teams and projects in a fast-paced environment.

  • Proficiency with ERP systems (e.g., NetSuite, NSPB) and consolidation tools.

  • Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills.

  • Ability to think through complex problems, determine proper processes, and derive accounting conclusions, and present results to the team.

  • Able to multi-task, prioritize, and manage projects/tasks in a fast-paced environment.

  • Ability to be a team player, and ability to work well in both In-Person & Remote work environments .

Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):

  • Competitive salary & equity compensation for full-time roles

  • Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days

  • Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

  • 401k benefits with employer matching contribution

  • Offsite team retreats

We are committed to building a workforce that reflects diverse perspectives and prioritizes ethics, wellness, and a strong sense of belonging. If you're excited about this role, we encourage you to apply—even if you're not sure if your background or experience is a perfect match.

About the Role:

Hims & Hers is seeking an Associate Director to join our Customer Insights & UX Research team on a full-time, six-month contract. In this role, you’ll lead high priority research initiatives that help shape how we understand our consumers and bring their voice into business, product, and brand decisions.

You’ll serve as the strategic insights lead across multiple categories, partnering closely with senior stakeholders in Marketing, Product, Brand, Comms, and Clinical to identify knowledge gaps, design research programs, and translate findings into actionable strategies that drive business impact. This is a temporary position for 6 months.

About You:

You’re a seasoned insights leader who combines research expertise with strategic intuition. You’ve mastered both foundational and fast-turn research approaches, know how to connect insights to key business objectives, and can influence decisions at the senior level. You bring deep curiosity about human behavior, an ability to “connect the dots,” and a passion for storytelling that makes data come alive.

You’re comfortable juggling multiple research objectives at once - from exploratory to evaluative, qual to quant, foundational to tactical - and choosing the right methodology to fit each business question. You thrive in environments where priorities evolve, navigating complexity with structure and clarity.

You’re equally at ease managing vendors and running research yourself - from study design and moderation to synthesis and executive storytelling, and you know how to balance rigor with pragmatism to drive impact.

You Will:

  • Lead research for two emerging categories while overseeing thought leadership and marketing claims initiatives that shape brand and business strategy.

  • Act as the go-to insights expert for assigned categories, deeply understanding priorities and identifying opportunities where research can drive impact

  • Design and manage end-to-end research, including vendor selection, contracting, methodology design, and analysis

  • Translate complex data from multiple sources (quant, qual, clinical, claims) into clear insights and business implications

  • Partner with cross-functional teams, including Marketing, Product, Brand, Comms, and Clinical Research to align insights with business goals and inform strategic decisions

  • Influence senior stakeholders, framing insights in the context of business challenges and opportunities

  • Track and socialize the impact of insights initiatives, ensuring visibility and alignment across teams

  • Elevate insights storytelling, ensuring the consumer voice is represented in strategic and creative forums

  • Collaborate with other Insights team members to connect learnings across categories and identify broader themes

  • Contribute to process and operational excellence in the Insights function (budgeting, vendor management, legal guidelines, and knowledge management)

You Have:

  • 10+ years of experience in consumer insights, market research, and UX research (mix of client- and agency-side experience preferred)

  • Demonstrated ability to lead strategic, multi-stakeholder research programs end-to-end

  • Proven experience influencing senior leaders and connecting insights to tangible business outcomes

  • Deep knowledge of both qualitative and quantitative methodologies

  • Strong project management skills; comfortable managing multiple initiatives simultaneously

  • Exceptional storytelling and communication skills - able to distill complex insights into simple, compelling narratives

  • Comfort working in ambiguous, fast-paced environments and shifting seamlessly between strategic and tactical execution

  • Familiarity with healthcare, wellness, or DTC industries is preferred

Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):

  • Competitive salary compensation

  • Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days

  • Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

  • 401k benefits with employer matching contribution

About the Role:

The Staff Accountant, Accounts Payable manages all aspects of day-to-day and month-end close related accounting operations, including, but not limited to, accounts payable corporate credit cards transaction management, accruals, reconciliations, and Flux Analysis . To support business growth, we have created the role of Staff Accountant, Accounts Payable. All responsibilities need to be performed in a timely and accurate manner, utilizing judgment, discretion, and critical thinking in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in accounting with direct accounts payable experience.

You Will:

  • Independently manage the accounts payable operations, including management of AP inbox, vendor onboarding, vendor inquiries, and preparation of AP reconciliations.

  • Support month-end close processes by researching and ensuring vendor invoices are properly coded; approved per accounting policies in the billing system, with appropriate support for processing. Applying analytical and problem solving skills to assess the appropriateness and accuracy of accounting accruals and book accruals accordingly.

  • Review corporate credit card coding, ensure all transactions are posted to the correct general ledger. Apply critical thinking skills to the review process, ensure only expenses that are compliant with corporate credit card policies are posted.

  • Independently review employee reimbursements, communicate with employees and managers to determine the validity and coding accuracy. Utilize discretion and professional judgement to resolve coding issues.

  • Complete reconciliations for the month-end close process, including assisting with completing account reconciliations and preparing/posting manual journal entries, in a timely and accurate manner. The staff accountant, AP role will use root cause analysis to resolve any vendor balance discrepancies

  • Independently review the work performed by the outsourced offshore accounting team, provide feedback, create new work streams and training instructions for the outsourced accounting team as needed.

  • Design and implement scalable processes to enhance accounting operations’ operational efficiency while maintaining accuracy, including the design and implementation of internal control measures and periodic review of compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley.

  • Independently assist with ad-hoc accounting projects and resolve issues arising from daily accounting operations processes.

  • Utilize professional expertise to develop and implement standard operating procedures related to accounting operations.

You Have:

  • Experience with managing vendor portfolio balances over $1B annually

  • Advanced Excel Skills required

  • Netsuite, BILL(.com), Brex, Coupa experience preferred

  • Top-level critical thinking and analytical skills

  • Detail-oriented and exceptionally organized

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and take ownership of work products. Proven ability to meet multiple deadlines in a fast-growing environment with frequently changing priorities.

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team and take on new tasks with various levels of difficulty in a fast-paced environment.

  • Must be proficient in the use of a spreadsheet (MS Excel and Google), word processing (MS Word and Google). Advanced Excel Skills preferred.

  • Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days

  • Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave

​​About the Role:

The Inventory Control Specialist Level I will be responsible for assisting on site operations in inventory control analysis, counting and inventory standard operating procedures. Candidates should have a background in pharmaceuticals, logistics, and inventory control practices along with familiarity with Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX). This role will report into the ICQA Area Manager/RX Inbound & Replenishment Area Manager.

You Will:

• Ensure timely receiving by our warehouses and received quantities match expected quantities

• Analyze inventory data and generate reports on inventory levels & stock movements

• Using reports, identify discrepancies between inventory records and physical counts and investigate root causes

• Assist in developing and implementing inventory control procedures and best practices to improve accuracy

• Assist in training operations on newly implemented inventory control procedures

• Collaborate with supply chain, procurement and warehouse teams to as needed for best practices & continuous process improvement

• Perform other duties as assigned

You Have:

• High School Diploma Required

• 3+ years of experience as an Inventory Control Specialist or similar role, preferable in the pharmaceutical industry Required

• 2+ years of experience in Pharmacy Supply Chain Management, or a related field Required

• Strong understanding of inventory management practices and procedures including pharmaceutical distribution, inventory control, quality management systems and regulatory requirements (e.g. SOX, FDA, CGMP, GDP) • Proficiency in inventory. management software and ERP systems (Netsuitem EPRO, SAP, etc.)

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills • Excellent communication, interpersonal and leadership skills with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively across all levels of the organization

• OH Pharmacy Technician Trainee license Upon Hire Required

Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):

  • Competitive salary & comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision

Conditions of Employment:

  • This position will require working with Hazardous Drugs (HD) and would require that Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) be worn for the length of working with these drugs. These items would include gloves, respiratory protection, gown and other items as required.

  • This position requires medical approval to wear respiratory protection in the form of negative or positive pressure respirators, including N95, full face respirator, SCBA, or Powered Air Purifying Respirator (PAPR).

  • Physical exertion required. Including, but not limited to, walking up to 50% of the time, standing up to 100% of the time, squatting and bending up to 20% of the time and lifting up to 80% of the time for up to a twelve hour shift. Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.

  • Due to the risk of reproductive capability in handling or compounding certain Hazardous Drugs (HD) associates must be willing to confirm that they understand the potential risks (teratogenicity, carcinogenicity and reproductive effects) of handling hazardous drugs.

From scheduling interviews and managing logistics to maintaining data accuracy in Ashby and improving operational workflows, you’ll ensure every process runs smoothly and every candidate interaction reflects the bar we hold as a company.


At Hims & Hers, our growth depends on both hiring exceptional talent and continuously leveling up how we hire. Recruiting Coordinators make that possible. You’ll be the operational backbone that helps us move fast, stay organized, and continually raise the bar for quality, not just in how we attract and hire talent but in how we develop internal excellence across interviewer shadow programs, process initiatives, and recruiting operations that scale with our business.


This role reports to the Sr. Manager of Technical Recruiting, and is a 6-month, temp-to-hire role with the potential to be extended or converted to a full-time position.

You Will:

  • Own interview scheduling end to end for Engineering, Product, and Analytics roles across time zones and hiring teams, ensuring a polished, exceptional candidate experience.

  • Partner closely with recruiters, sourcers, and hiring managers to anticipate needs, resolve scheduling conflicts, and move candidates through the funnel with precision and urgency.

  • Support technical recruiting data integrity and reporting accuracy in Ashby, ensuring clean pipelines and reliable insights for the team.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with executive assistants, leadership, and interviewers to coordinate complex panels, including senior-level and leadership interviews.

  • Contribute to and support process improvement projects across our tech domains, including the Interview Shadow & Reverse-Shadow Program and ongoing recruiting process optimization initiatives.

  • Collaborate with a high-performing, low-ego recruiting team that values curiosity, ownership, and humor, continuously improving how we operate and show up for candidates and each other.

  • Champion candidate experience excellence, identifying opportunities to improve workflows, templates, and communications that reflect our brand and values.

  • Assist with hiring events and ad hoc TA projects supporting the continued growth of our Technical Recruiting function.

You Have:

  • 2+ years of recruiting coordination or scheduling experience, ideally supporting recruiters and sourcers for technical and high-volume teams in a high-growth or startup environment.

  • Proficiency with Ashby as an ATS (or similar), along with GSuite.

  • A mindset grounded in ownership, precision, and continuous improvement. You anticipate needs and act before problems arise.

  • Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills. You build trust across all levels, from engineers to executives.

  • Experience managing logistics across multiple time zones, including U.S. and international candidates.

  • Comfort working through shifting priorities while maintaining structure and calm under pressure.

  • A passion for process excellence, operational rigor, and creating memorable candidate experiences.

  • Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days

About the Role:

The Accounting GL/CLOSE team manages all aspects of day-to-day GL Accounting and Close responsibilities for areas, including revenue (online and retail). To support business growth, we have created the role of Staff Accountant (Revenue) to assist with all areas of accounting for our retail revenue relationships. The role will primarily focus on managing the retail revenue process, which includes overseeing contract terms, ensuring accurate billing and revenue recognition, and reconciling retail accounts to maintain the integrity of financial reporting.

You Will:

  • Create and maintain adequate accounting procedures for complex transactions and procedures related to Revenue.

  • Partner with cross functional business owners (Operations/ Data engineering) to develop new accounting processes and month-end close procedures for new or changed business operations with oversight from Senior Accountant and Manager.

  • Own month-end close process with minimal review comments from Senior Accountants and Managers, including completing account reconciliations and preparing/posting manual journal entries, in a timely and accurate manner.

  • Review the work performed by the outsourced accounting team and support preparation of new training instructions for the accounting team as needed.

  • Assist with external audit and Sarbanes–Oxley Act (SOX) requests on quarterly and annual basis.

  • Aid in preparation of slide decks for Quarterly CFO review meetings.

  • Assist with ad-hoc accounting projects and resolve issues arising from daily accounting operations for retail.

  • Enhance accounting operations procedures to adhere to the public company Sarbanes-Oxley Act control requirements and to US GAAP.

  • Serve as subject matter expert on accounting procedures for Revenue for various business stakeholders including but not limited to Operations, Retail, Data Eng, and External Audit.

You Have:

  • 2-4+ years of experience in the accounting profession.

  • Big 4 accounting firm experience strongly preferred.

  • BA or BS degree from a top-ranking university in accounting, business administration, or economics preferred.

  • CPA license or active progress toward CPA certification is strongly preferred.

  • Advanced Excel skills required; experience with ERP systems (e.g., NetSuite) and expense tracking/reporting tools is a plus.

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret financial data and resolve complex issues.

  • Exceptional attention to detail and a high level of organizational ability.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey financial information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Ability to think through complex problems, determine proper processes, and derive accounting conclusions, and present results to the team.

  • Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment while meeting deadlines with accuracy and accountability.

  • Ability to be a team player, and ability to work well in both In-Person & Remote work environments.

You’ll partner closely with CX leadership, BPO partners, Finance, and Analytics teams to ensure the workforce model scales efficiently and supports exceptional customer experiences.

About the Role:

The Senior Accountant, Payroll will primarily manage the full cycle accounting for payroll, including payroll processing, reconciliation, and reporting, while ensuring compliance with company policy as well as federal, state, and local payroll and tax regulations. All responsibilities need to be performed in a timely and accurate manner, utilizing judgment, discretion, and critical thinking in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in accounting with direct payroll experience and a strong understanding of payroll accounting principles.

You Will:

  • Manage full-cycle semi-monthly payroll processing across multiple subsidiaries for employees working in nearly all 50 states. This includes incorporating payroll data from multiple internal departments and external benefit providers, while maintaining supporting documentation for all changes.

  • Support month-end close process by ensuring accurate and timely recording of payroll transactions in the general ledger, preparing reports, and managing reconciliations.

  • Process off-cycle payroll batches (terminations, equity ISO/NSO/ESPP/RSU releases, reimbursements, etc), as necessary.

  • Review and process hours from a timekeeping system on a semi-monthly basis and import to the payroll module; independently identify and investigate payroll discrepancies and facilitate resolution.

  • Create reconciliation reports at month-end and year-end for 401k, benefits, and equity team needs. Ensure payroll compliance related to multi-state/multi-jurisdiction tax withholding, garnishments, and key annual audits (e.g., 401 (k), workers compensations, external financial audit).

  • Design and implement scalable processes to enhance payroll operational efficiency while maintaining accuracy, including the design and implementation of internal control measures and periodic review of compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley.

  • Prepare payroll reports for various internal departments such as Finance, Accounting, Legal, Equity and People Operations.

  • Reconcile and validate 401(k)/Roth contributions and resolve discrepancies.

  • Review W-2s, and ensure W-2s are issued accurately on time.

  • Independently manage payroll accounting email inbox and respond to payroll-related questions promptly,effectively and accurately based on professional knowledge, investigation of issues and critical thinking of resolutions for reported matters.

  • Maintain good recordkeeping practices and payroll files.

  • Develop and implement standard operating procedures related to payroll accounting.

  • Assist with other accounting and finance projects as needed.

You Have:

  • BS/BA degree in accounting, finance, or a related field

  • 5+ Years of experience in a payroll function preferably in a fast-paced/ public company environment.

  • Experience with multi-state Payrolls larger than 1,000 employees with both exempt and nonexempt employees.

  • Detailed knowledge of payroll compliance and working knowledge of state/federal employment laws/regulations. Shift Differential experience preferred.

  • Paylocity and NetSuite experience preferred.

  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and take ownership of work products. Proven ability to meet multiple deadlines in a fast-growing environment with frequently changing priorities.

  • Possess a tech-savvy mindset and passion for end-to-end design and improvement.

  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team and take on new tasks with various levels of difficulty in a fast-paced environment.

  • Must be proficient in the use of a spreadsheet (MS Excel and Google), word processing (MS Word and Google). Advanced Excel Skills preferred.

Nice to Have:

  • A solutions-oriented team player who enjoys a dynamic work environment.

  • Ability to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner.

  • Demonstrated skill with business judgment and problem-solving.

  • Ability to effectively work with all levels and cross-functionally within the company.

  • Strong organizational skills and ability to meet tight deadlines.

  • Demonstrated ability to complete with discretion and confidentiality.

  • Strong interpersonal skills.

  • Strong analytical skills, with a sharp focus on detail.

  • Maintain a helpful and positive attitude during periods of high volume.

  • Strong system and data flow knowledge. Ability to learn and adapt to new process flows and software technologies.

Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):

  • Competitive salary & equity compensation for full-time roles

  • Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days

  • Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)

  • 401k benefits with employer matching contribution

  • Offsite team retreats

We are committed to building a workforce that reflects diverse perspectives and prioritizes ethics, wellness, and a strong sense of belonging. If you're excited about this role, we encourage you to apply—even if you're not sure if your background or experience is a perfect match.

Hims considers all qualified applicants for employment, including applicants with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the California Fair Chance Act, and any similar state or local fair chance laws.

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Hims & Hers offers nonprescription products and access to highly personalized prescription solutions for a variety of conditions related to mental health, sexual health, hair care, skincare, heart health, and more.

We are seeking a visionary and strategic Sr. Director Technology Optimization to lead the transformation of our Clinical and Customer Operations. You will be a senior member of the leadership team, responsible for driving the strategy and execution for a critical segment of our operational technology. This role requires a blend of deep technical expertise, strategic thinking, and a proven ability to lead teams. You will work closely with leadership across engineering, data science, clinical, and business functions to turn a bold vision into a portfolio of impactful, scalable, and ethical AI solutions that drive significant business growth and help our customers feel great.

You Will:

  • Build, lead, and scale a high-performing team of technology professionals, including hiring, mentoring, and developing senior talent.

  • Define and own the product vision, strategy, and multi-year roadmap for your specific area.

  • Act as a key thought leader on technology and AI product innovation, influencing senior leadership on investments and strategic direction for your domain.

  • Drive the end-to-end execution of your team's product portfolio, establishing processes and standards that ensure the delivery of high-quality, impactful solutions.

  • Foster a culture of deep customer empathy, data-driven decision-making, and rapid experimentation to accelerate learning and innovation.

  • Partner with senior leaders across the company to ensure strategic alignment and resource allocation for your team's technology priorities.

  • Establish and champion a robust framework for the ethical and responsible development of AI, ensuring fairness, transparency, and patient privacy are at the core of your products.

You Have:

  • A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related technical field; an advanced degree (MBA, PhD) is preferred, but not required.

  • 10+ years of product and technology experience, with at least 5 years in a people management role leading technical teams.

  • Exceptional strategic and business acumen, with experience translating high-level business objectives into a clear, investable product strategy that drives measurable results.

  • Outstanding communication, influence, and executive presence, with a demonstrated ability to align and inspire senior leadership and cross-functional teams.

  • Proven success in building and leading high-performing product management teams in a fast-paced environment.

  • Experience in healthcare, telehealth, or other regulated industries is preferred.

  • A deep passion for leveraging technology to solve complex problems, improve healthcare outcomes, and deliver exceptional customer experiences.
